text: Medusa is a mountain at the border of Argentina and Chile. It has a height of . It's located at Catamarca Province, Tinogasta Department, at the Puna de Atacama. == First Ascent == Medusa was first climbed by Claudio Bravo (Argentina) on 22/01/1986. == Elevation == Based on the elevation provided by the available Digital elevation models, SRTM (6119m), ASTER (6101m), SRTM filled with ASTER (6119m), ALOS (6101m), TanDEM-X(6163m), Medusa is about 6130 meters above sea level. The height of the nearest key col is , so its prominence is . Medusa is listed as mountain, based on the Dominance system, and its dominance is 8.56%. Its parent peak is Ojos del Salado and the Topographic isolation is . This information was obtained during a research by Suzanne Imber in 2014. == References == == External links == * Elevation information about Medusa * Weather Forecast at Medusa Category:Six-thousanders of the Andes Category:Mountains of Argentina Category:Mountains of Chile
title: Medusa (mountain)
